channel.title: Real-Time Strategy Games
channel.description:
If you've ever played one, what is your opinion on the gameplay? Can you name some good ones you have found?
Personally I like the concept; it's a great way to pass smaller amounts of time and then do something else for a while.
The one I play currently is ok, it's called War Of Legends (published by Jagex), been playing it for a few months now.

item.title: Real-Time Strategy Games
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

I’ve always found Command and Conquer pretty boring due to the shallow strategy involved.

Read full topic

@ollie123 wrote:

Command and Conquer: Generals Zero Hour, Command and Conquer Red Alert 2 were decent.

Red Alert 3 and Command and Conquer 3 were shit.

item.title: Real-Time Strategy Games
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“IlikeArrays, post:29, topic:384235”][quote author=Niall link=topic=479997.msg3516213#msg3516213 date=1299019779]

Currently playing AoE III. I like the graphics and how well the computer plays back. If I play AoE II the computer ends up being fucking easy on expert :([/quote]

Computers putting up a good fight? Hah. AoE3 Expert comps(vanilla civs at least), typical 5-9 minutes without attacking and as long as you can defend and attack, it’s easy to slug it out with 3 experts.

The only reason the computers put up a good fight is at the start of death match they rush. The computer can do multiple things all at once while a player has to rush to every single event. I do not have any of the hot keys down. Might be easier if I choose a different civilization as well. Ottomans are only good for the villagers being auto built.[/quote]

Deathmatch eww. In a regular game ottomans are actually pretty strong, iirc janissaries are a lot stronger than muskets and you can’t easily counter them until age 3 where you get skirmishers, in which case 3 spahi will rape them with minimal janissary support.

Computers can multitask extremely well but late game they tend to neglect their economy and they never micro, at best they have a chance of countering your units if you tend to spam them but they always attack with huge armies and just send everything in letting the game mechanics choose what gets attacked. All you really need to do is defend your base so you have a strong economy then micro your army, even if it’s just something small like sending heavy cavalry to kill skirmishers, skirmishers to kill heavy infantry, heavy infantry to kill cavalry etc.

ps the only hotkeys you need to know are h builds a house, b builds/goes to barracks and v is to build villagers.

Read full topic

Currently playing AoE III. I like the graphics and how well the computer plays back. If I play AoE II the computer ends up being fucking easy on expert

Computers putting up a good fight? Hah. AoE3 Expert comps(vanilla civs at least), typical 5-9 minutes without attacking and as long as you can defend and attack, it’s easy to slug it out with 3 experts.

[quote=“Greeny, post:8, topic:384235”]Best (text-based) RTS: Planetarion

Can’t play it unless you’re willing to give up sleeping. Fuck yeah hardcore. I’ve played it on and off for 11 years.[/quote]

Haha oh wow, I played that before I knew about runescape. Gave my account away when I had to go on holiday(accounts get deleted after 10+ days if you don’t login) and what the game was called. I knew it was Planeta-something though.

item.title: Real-Time Strategy Games
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“IlikeArrays, post:26, topic:384235”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=479997.msg3515609#msg3515609 date=1298949669]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=479997.msg3515578#msg3515578 date=1298948069]

Star Wars: Empire at War anyone?
[/quote]I had Star Wars Galactic Battlegrounds - It used to be my favorite game yearsss aggooo
[/quote]l0ol Galactic Battlegrounds was the biggest AoE2 clone ever, simply cos Microsoft licensed the engine to LucasArts, and they basically replaced the gfx and added nothin new to the table p much.

So what for it being a clone? I fucking loved that game. It was awesome having a bunch of jedi in a army like that.

Currently playing AoE III. I like the graphics and how well the computer plays back. If I play AoE II the computer ends up being fucking easy on expert

Anybody ever get interested in AoM? I like it and hate it at the same time. Can’t figure out why.[/quote]Lmfao if you had an army of like 30 jedi, you were basically unstopable, if you had the right skills researched. Convert any buildings and shit lol

item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

C&C: Zero Hour… countless hours have been lost on that game. Just online with a buddy, going against max bots and taking our time to build an empire of hacker/drop pad/black market farms, resulting in us getting bored after 3 hours and sending our huge armies on a 15 minute rampage of giggles!

That is correct is the answer to the question, are you cool?

Read full topic

Which C&C did you play?

Throughout the years, probably all of them. Not a big fan of any though, I only play it sometimes at LAN parties because my friends like it.

Radeon:

As for turn-based. See heroes of might and magic III

I’ll have to look into it.

item.title: Real-Time Strategy Games
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:17, topic:384235”][quote author=maniown link=topic=479997.msg3514941#msg3514941 date=1298901315]

great way to pass smaller amounts

Lol matches in AOE take like 7 hours

Thats only when me and Speljohan go at it. I get a 24-pack of mountain dew and enough pop-tarts to last me a week when we play Aoe2.
[/quote]Then maniown pulls a drush and i lose within 5 minutes, resulting in the shortest matches ever, so he usually ends up giving the mountain dew away.[/quote]Lol, I hate rushes. I usually write custom game settings that slows unit building a TON for the first 5-10 minutes.

[quote=“cane, post:18, topic:384235”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=479997.msg3513980#msg3513980 date=1298809196]
The one I play currently is ok, it’s called War Of Legends (published by Jagex), been playing it for a few months now.
[/quote]
I had the highest ranked clan on there when it started (:[/quote]Nice! I started in beta, wasn’t in a clan. Joined Epic a few weeks ago (rank 2). What server were you on, if you remember? I’m on Royal Garden.
